an8.64:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Gāyā on Gāyā Head.
an8.64:1.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
an8.64:1.3: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was still not awake but intent on awakening—I perceived light but did not see visions.
an8.64:2.2: ‘What if I were to both perceive light and see visions?
an8.64:2.3: Then my knowledge and vision would become even more purified.’
an8.64:3.1: So after some time, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, I perceived light and saw visions.
an8.64:3.2: But I didn’t associate with those deities, converse, or engage in discussion.
an8.64:4.2: ‘What if I were to perceive light and see visions; and associate with those deities, converse, and engage in discussion?
an8.64:4.3: Then my knowledge and vision would become even more purified.’
an8.64:5.1: So after some time … I perceived light and saw visions. And I associated with those deities, conversed, and engaged in discussion.

an8.64:6.3: and find out which orders of gods those deities come from?
an8.64:6.4: Then my knowledge and vision would become even more purified.’
an8.64:7.1: So after some time … I perceived light and saw visions. And I associated with those deities … And I found out which orders of gods those deities came from.

an8.64:8.2: ‘What if I were to perceive light and see visions; and associate with those deities, converse, and engage in discussion;
an8.64:8.3: and find out which orders of gods those deities come from;
an8.64:8.4: and what deeds caused those deities to be reborn there after passing away from here;
an8.64:8.5: and what deeds caused those deities to have such food and such an experience of pleasure and pain;
an8.64:8.6: and that these deities have a life-span of such a length; and whether or not I have previously lived together with those deities.
an8.64:8.7: Then my knowledge and vision would become even more purified.’
an8.64:9.5: I found out whether or not I have previously lived together with those deities.
an8.64:10.1: As long as my knowledge and vision about the deities was not fully purified from these eight perspectives, I didn’t announce my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
an8.64:10.2: But when my knowledge and vision about the deities was fully purified from these eight perspectives, I announced my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.
an8.64:10.3: Knowledge and vision arose in me:
an8.64:10.4: ‘My freedom is unshakable; this is my last rebirth; now there’ll be no more future lives.’”
